freshwater reservoir project in
Khanh An commune, U Minh district, Ca Mau province
started construction in early 2022. Nearing
completion. This is the largest freshwater reservoir
in the
West by surface area.  The lake is up to 60 hectares, the lake is
more than 1.2 km long and more than 480
m wide with a capacity of up to 3.85 million cubic meters of
water. The freshwater reservoir was initially
approved with a construction budget of 184 billion
VND after  The construction process has generated
a number of additional items, so it has been proposed to increase
the budget to 234 billion. Up to
now, the construction unit has completed a
volume of work reaching more than 86.6 million minutes of the
freshwater meter contract value.  When completed, it will
help more than 113,000 households in U
Minh Tran, Cha Thoi districts and part of The Binh district
have clean water for
use. In addition, the lake will also store water to prevent
fires for tens of thousands of hectares of forest
in the dry season.  The People's Committee of
Ca Mao province has just approved extending the
construction time of the lake until May 30,
2024, making it the largest freshwater lake
in the West behind the completion schedule compared to
the original estimate with a time of up to 17 years.

five people died and many others
were injured when the row  Aid dropped in
Gaza encountered problems while plans to build
barriers in Gaza to deliver humanitarian goods were met with
criticism. The incident occurred on the morning of March 8
near the Anati refugee camp, one of the
devastated areas.  most serious In
Gaza, planes dropped relief supplies from the air,
but even though one cargo box was
not working, the cargo box crashed into the roof and
fell on victims in the Anati camp
west of Gaza city. The incident occurred
in the context of  Bringing aid into
Gaza by land faces many difficulties.
Hamas media office in
Gaza confirmed the accident, criticized the
method of dropping aid from the air
and called for the opening of land border gates.
March 8 occurred one day
after US President Jo Biden announced
plans to build a temporary seascape in
Gaza to deliver humanitarian goods.
US officials said the operation would take
weeks to plan and implement.
Meanwhile, President of the European Commission
Usuda V yesterday confirmed that
international donors have established a sea corridor
from the island to help
remove microplastic fragments stuck to
arteries in the human body.  can increase
the risk of heart disease. This is the result of a
study published in the
New England Journal of Medicine
recently, among 304 patients who underwent a
58-minute carotid artery cleaning procedure were found to
have microscopic fragments.  Plastics and
nanoplastics have jagged edges in plaque
inside blood vessels. Through research based on
age, gender, body mass index and
health conditions such as diabetes
or abnormal cholesterol,
scientists discovered that  Patients with
microplastics in their blood were
nearly five times more likely to develop cardiovascular disease
than other patients. The team
also found that people with
plastic particles in their carotid plaques were at increased
risk.  The risk of having a heart attack, stroke
or death is 4.5 times higher in the next 3 years.
Scientists recommend that no matter
how microplastics enter the body, they
pose a risk to
the patient's health.  There are microplastics or Nanoplastics
in plaque and there are also high levels of inflammatory proteins
in the
blood. Los Angeles city officials,

3 km wide off the coast of Huntington

oil leak may have come from a
crude oil rig at sea. The
government has opened an investigation to find out the

announced that it is monitoring the situation.
Status of beaches from the
coast guard. Environmental impact assessment and
discussion on how to deal with the previous oil spill
in 2021. In this same area, there was an
oil spill at sea, the
cause of which was determined to be a tank.  An oil pipeline
placed under the sea spilled
about 10,000 liters of crude oil. The leak
forced the government to close 24 km of
beaches between Huntington beach and laguna
beach and at the same time block fishing.
This MU environmental incident also  killing many species of
birds and seafood, mostly due to oil contamination.

in the capital.  Roma Italia This is the
birthplace of costumes that have
appeared in major cinema works such as
Titanic and is behind 17 Oscars for
best costume design.
Although the Oscar award is awarded
to the designer, not  Not a tailor,
but tally costume is still highly
respected by filmmakers for cutting and sewing
elaborate costumes for Saturday art. The
tailor's journey began with
founder Umberto's passion for collecting antique clothes.
terali he searched for
antique costumes in flea markets around the
world and built a collection of more than 15,000
items spanning from the mid-18th century to the
1980s. This collection became a source of
material and inspiration for
cinema costume designers while the
experienced tailors at Trali have brought
these designs from the page to life
over six decades having sewn more than
300,000 costumes which we still
cut and sew by hand.
These costumes cannot be made in a
factory. The factory is for the production of robots or
Futuristic sets, and
these costumes must be sewn by hand. This year,
Trali collaborated with two designers from the
movie Napoleon.  She helped put the film on
the list of nominees for the next best costume design award
